short_description: Discover the Caribbean Netherlands, three special municipalities of the Netherlands in the Caribbean. Experience world-class diving in Bonaire, explore the historic charm of Sint Eustatius, and hike the pristine wilderness of Saba in these unique island destinations.

health.tap_water_safety: Safe to drink - excellent water quality
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores

tipping.hotels: Tipping is appreciated for porters ($1-2 per bag) and housekeeping ($2-5 per day)
tipping.guides: 10-15% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10-15% tip is customary for good service, though some restaurants may include a service charge
tipping.taxis: Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory, rounding up is common

weather.title: The Caribbean Netherlands has a tropical climate with warm temperatures year-round. The dry season runs from January to September, while the wet season is from October to December, with minimal temperature variation throughout the year.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Perfect weather with low humidity, minimal rainfall, and warm temperatures. This is the peak tourist season, ideal for diving, snorkeling, beach activities, and outdoor adventures. Best time for visiting Bonaire's famous dive sites

when_to_visit.title: Shoulder Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Warm temperatures with occasional brief showers. Fewer crowds and lower prices make this a great time to visit. Still excellent weather for diving, snorkeling, and exploring the islands

when_to_visit.title: Diving Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Bonaire is known as a diver's paradise with excellent conditions year-round. The water temperature stays warm, and visibility is consistently excellent, making it perfect for diving and snorkeling at any time

weather.best_time: The best time to visit the Caribbean Netherlands is during the dry season from January to September when the weather is perfect with low humidity, minimal rainfall, and ideal conditions for diving, snorkeling, beach activities, and outdoor adventures
